DataElement.preferredName: Head and Neck Surgery Specific Complication Otologic Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the kind of  otologic complication specific to head and neck surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Head and Neck Surgery Specified Complication Ear
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any surgery involving a structure in the head and neck region._Clearly and explicitly stated._Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure._A sense organ needed for the detection of sound and for establishing balance. The outer ear consists of the auricle, the ear canal as well as the tympanic membrane. The middle ear is made up of an air-filled cavity behind the tympanic membrane that contains the ossicles (malleus, incus and stapes). The inner ear is made up of the cochlea needed for hearing and the vestibular apparatus required for balance.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Head and Neck Surgery Specified Complication
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any surgery involving a structure in the head and neck region.:Clearly and explicitly stated.:Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

Concepts.definition: Any surgery involving a structure in the head and neck region.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

Property.preferredDefinition: A sense organ needed for the detection of sound and for establishing balance. The outer ear consists of the auricle, the ear canal as well as the tympanic membrane. The middle ear is made up of an air-filled cavity behind the tympanic membrane that contains the ossicles (malleus, incus and stapes). The inner ear is made up of the cochlea needed for hearing and the vestibular apparatus required for balance.

Concepts.definition: A sense organ needed for the detection of sound and for establishing balance. The outer ear consists of the auricle, the ear canal as well as the tympanic membrane. The middle ear is made up of an air-filled cavity behind the tympanic membrane that contains the ossicles (malleus, incus and stapes). The inner ear is made up of the cochlea needed for hearing and the vestibular apparatus required for balance.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.value: Unexpected sensorineural hearing loss or vertigo
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Unexpected Vertigo Or Sensorineural Hearing Loss

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Unexpected Vertigo Or Sensorineural Hearing Loss
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Something that is not planned or anticipated.: A feeling of movement, a sensation as if the external world were revolving around the patient (objective vertigo) or as if he himself were revolving in space (subjective vertigo). Vertigo is medically distinct from dizziness, lightheadedness, and unsteadiness.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Hearing loss resulting from damage to the cochlea, auditory nerve and/or brainstem.

Concepts.definition: Something that is not planned or anticipated.

A feeling of movement, a sensation as if the external world were revolving around the patient (objective vertigo) or as if he himself were revolving in space (subjective vertigo). Vertigo is medically distinct from dizziness, lightheadedness, and unsteadiness.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Hearing loss resulting from damage to the cochlea, auditory nerve and/or brainstem.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
